alert.note: Alert for Graham; Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 6:55PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Macon, south central Swain and southern Graham Counties through 730 PM EST... At 654 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Murphy, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Robbinsville, Nantahala Lake, Wesser, Burningtown, Kyle, Nantahala, Wayah Bald, Cowee and Luada. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
